result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman Gregory Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Norman Gregory Miller in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:02 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Also has 15 CM 246.  State recites plea 15 CM 246 plead to Misd. bail jump and 15 CM 227 DRI - probation 1 year AODA - absolute sobriety - $579.00 including costs.  Atty MCL agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty and 15 CM 227 is dismissed and read-in.  State argues sentencing.  Atty McL argues sentencing.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - fine plus costs $579.00 - absolute sobriety - AODA and any follow thru -

No abusive Contact with  -Sherri Sibila
  
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim " Sherri Sibila   " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

ADDRESS INFO for Norman Gregory Miller
Current: 15093W State Rd 77,  #3, Hayward, WI 54843 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2015)
Prior: 15093W Sth 77   - #3, Hayward, WI 54843

A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

Defendant Norman Gregory Miller in court with attorney James McLaughlin .  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   NG Plea entered by court.  Request to modify bond and have the no contact lifted. I understand that "domestic abuse" means:

A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appeared in custody via video - defendant is satisfied with appearing via video - PC found by the court.
